thread.title: Broncos still waiting on Tony Romo, if he’s released
thread.title_full: Broncos still waiting on Tony Romo, if he’s released

author: Darin Gantt
title: Broncos still waiting on Tony Romo, if he’s released
text:
Mar 7, 2017 7:47 AM 
Boy, talk about desperation, Broncos would be better off bringing Peyton back instead. darocnessmonsta says: Mar 7, 2017 7:49 AM 
I love Romo and if he is so sure he can still play he should bet on himself and do what it takes to have a trade go thru that way insuring he has control over what team he goes too and helping the team that gave him a chance to become an NFL qb everyone is happy in the end!! wib22 says: Mar 7, 2017 7:52 AM 
Romo behind horse teeth’s awful line? Good job monks he’ll be injured by week 6. snowdood163 says: Mar 7, 2017 7:55 AM 
Imagine that, a moronic New England stool pigeon interjecting his loser opinion on a Broncos thread. Just worry about your own team renobinroxbury. jonathankrobinson424 says: Mar 7, 2017 7:56 AM 
I don’t get the mad rush to sign Romo. He’s one clean hit from separting his shoulder again. I don’t think he’ll last more than 5 games with whomever he signs for. Draft another QB and pickup a health jouneyman veteran.(McCown?) gixrider says: Mar 7, 2017 8:02 AM 
Of course, then it becomes a question of how far Jerry Jones is willing to go to do right by Romo. Houston has been mentioned as a possible trade partner, 
Elway knows that Jerry would sell his soul to the devil before he would help Houston potentially advance in the playoffs. I think he would rather help a division rival than his state rival. Another NFC east team does well and he loses bragging rights…..Houston doing well potentially costs him in-state fan support which translates into money (gear purchases, etc.). Mar 7, 2017 8:03 AM 
Boy, talk about desperation, Broncos would be better off bringing Peyton back instead.
